<meta name="Description" content="Degree courses. Degree courses available - Trinity & All Saints offers many modular degrees to match your future career plans, all of which are accredited by the University of Leeds">

sociology

<td bgcolor="#ebebeb" class="menunormalcell"><a href="attachments.htm" title="Placements and Careers">::
<table width="98%" height="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" summary="layout table">
students undertake diverse attachments in their first and
second years. These include work with police services, social
services, local authorities, community centres, marketing
and advertising agencies, newspapers and community groups.
Many of these attachments link directly with future careers.
Sometimes attachments can lead to an understanding that
a certain intended career is not, despite high expectations,
sociology students find themselves using knowledge about
social research in their attachments and making use of information
and communications technology skills learned from sociology
sociology students with Management and Media have good employment
records during the initial phases of their careers and through
their subsequent development. A number of sociology graduates
each year go on to MA courses, sometimes with built in professional
qualifications. Some aim for PhD registration and work in
social research right away or after completing an MA course.
A number head for careers in education through a postgraduate
course leading to teaching careers at primary, secondary
or further education levels. Some use their professional
skills to move towards careers in banking, insurance or
accountancy. Some take further qualifications which lead
to careers in social work, including probation work, or
time to time we are in touch with a number of former graduates
who are now in mid-career. These include some who have created
distinctive careers, in personnel management, accountancy,
broadcasting, the theatre and television, public relations,
the police, the priesthood and teaching at Colleges and
College careers service will guide you to sources of information
about career opportunities.
